org.sbrubbles.conditio

Class Condition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sbrubbles.conditio.Condition
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Notice

    public class Condition
extends Object
    Represents an unusual situation, which the running code doesn't know how to deal with, but the code that called it might. Conditions are meant to be signalled, which is how lower-level code communicates what happened.

    This class is the superclass of all conditions in this library. It provides a callback for Scope.signal, which creates a protocol that Condition subtypes may override. See Notice for an example. In the default implementation, an exception will be thrown if no handler is found.

    See Also:
    Scope.signal(Condition, Restart...), Notice

        public Condition()

    • Method Detail

      • onHandlerNotFound

        public Object onHandlerNotFound(Scope scope)
                         throws HandlerNotFoundException
        Called when no handler was found.

        This implementation errors out with a HandlerNotFoundException. Other subtypes may compute some values to return.

        Parameters:
        scope - where the handler search started.
        Returns:
        the value to be returned by signal.
        Throws:
        HandlerNotFoundException - if no handler is found.
